Posts.Content: Hi my name is christine and I am a 4 year breast cancer survivor stage 3 breast cancer. I had my right breast removed and was taking tamoxifen for 2-1/2 years. I developed severe side effects where I needed a complete hysterectormy because of it. I am now on Femara and all is fine. Its scary everytime something happens but try to remain positive. I remember when I lost my hair...I had to go to my granddaughter's first communion...and my hair was in knots...but I was saved by wearing a hat on that occasion. Losing your hair as well as thinning hair is quite difficult for any woman as we are judged by it as well as having breasts. I have come to full term as I did not have breast reconstruction because of side effects...but I am still alive to enjoy my family. Try to be positive as best as you can. I do a lot of praying and helping others in their fight against breast cancer. Please respond as we can keep in touch with each other....Live life....
Posts.Title: Hair Loss From Femera

Posts.Content: My name is Christine and I am a 4 year breast cancer survivor who had right breast removed. I was on tamoxifen for 2-1/2 yrs but developed a serious side effect and had to have hysterectormy because it became pre-cancerous. With cancer its like always waiting for the shoe to drop. I am now on Femera....since October 2005....so far so good. My hair did not grow back completely as I always had long hair. It was very traumatic but life goes on...and I enjoy everyday that I am alive. Keep fighting....hair or not...you are still alive....enjoy your family and friends...keep in touch..I will say a prayer for you.

Posts.Content: On 6/21/2007 Noreneol wrote: ...I have been having pain,tenderness,and soreness in my breast since last year. I went to the doctor and they wrote on the report it is "a palpable abnormality." In other words,there is something growing there. They thought it was a cyst,as I have had fibrocystic disease a few years back. So they send me for a mammo & said there was nothing there! Fine. But now,this year,the pain is still there,in and around the breast,outside quadrant and near the nipple. Also it hurts when I lie on it,pain in my underarm too that was horrible a couple times. A few days before my period,I saw some stuff coming out of that breast,clear fluid,then it turned white. I can squeeze it out & it also comes out by itself. As a matter of fact,for a long time I've had sudden spotting from that breast,very briefly,but this came out more this time. I have NEVER had any kind of nipple discharge in my life,only when I had milk in the breasts for the kids. I'm hoping it was cyclical,but,as I said,this is the 1st time I EVER had anything like this. Nipple also looks kinda strange,and breast feels kinda rough,like the pores in it are enlarged. What do you guys make of this? Thank you, N.Y.  I am a 4 1/2 year breast cancer survivor who had a radical masetctomy. I had fibrocystic breast disease which started in 1984. I had several biopsies, all benign. and lumpectomy. In 2001 I started to feel completely fatigued, went to personal physician, had vitamin b12 shots....nothing worked until I went to Gyn....she said I had a lump and needed to see an oncologist right away....I did and also went for 2nd opinion. I had no discharge and no pain in breast...but had another mamogram, ultrasound...oncologist found breast cancer. I'm not saying that you have this but you should get another opinion, go to a different imaging place...and visit your gyn doctor...preferably a female...they seem to understand more. I am doing fine and hope you will respond to this message....but don't wait...get another opinion right away...a radiologist is only as good as they read it....take care

Posts.Content: On 3/29/2007 Commonsense wrote:  Actually it is usually the other way around. Lumpectomyis  as successful as breast removal and maybe more so.  I would google the information.  Also there are better inhibtors than Tamoxifen. Tamoxifen has way too many side effects.Tamoxifen is falling out of favour. Femera is a much safer hormone inhibitor and way less side effects.  Please look this up on the net along with "rates of remission for mastectomy versus lumpectomy" On 3/29/2007 Spiritsquad wrote: If I have dcis and I remove my breast won't I be removing all the dcis hence lessening the chances. See what I have been struggling with is I just have been notified that I need a re excision due to poor margins I have necrosis cells I have solid pattern with high grade on my first biopsy and intermediate grade on the lymphectomy biopsy. I have no great attachment to my breast and my spouse wants me to have it removed to lesson worry of reoocurrance. with reconstructive surgery as an option I guess the thought of removing my breast w/reconstruction and not having to go through more reexcisions (Possibly) and also not having to go through Radiation as well I am not a gambler and from what I have researched so far a masectomy seems the savest route to take. I have yet to read or hear that lumpectomy with radiation and tamoxifen has a better cure rate than masectomy. I have heard that its about the same I guess I am just a littel confused.  Thanks for your answers they are greatly appreciated.  God Bless,  Spiritsquad     I am a breast cancer survivor 4-1/2 years....after taking tamoxifen for 2-1/2 years, I needed 2 dnc's and eventually last year had a hysterectomy because of all the serious problems I had with it...it became pre-cancerous. I did the right thing but had to convince my oncologist that I needed to go onto Femera....which I have been on since and so far no problems. You need to address this...I think down the road tamoxifen will be considered dangerous.
